types.description: Receives a float packet and converts it to a string one.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the float value to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/float-to-string

members.description: Format string to be used in the conversion. The syntax is the same as Python's string.format() -- https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str.format --, except that we got no format recursion, no '!' conversions, and the attribute names must be one of the integer fields (val, min, max, step). Numbered fields will get to them in this order. Naturally, there is no field attribute nor field index dereferencing either.
members.name: format_spec

out_ports.description: Float converted to string with 6 digits after decimal-point character.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to boolean.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/string-to-boolean

out_ports.description: Sends true if the received string is 'true' and false, if 'false'. It ignores case. If that string is different from those, no packet is sent.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to byte.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/string-to-byte

out_ports.description: Sends the byte-converted value on success. It does not send anything if a valid byte can't be parsed. The input value is expected to be on base 16 and may include '0x' prefix.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to float.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/string-to-float

out_ports.description: Sends the float-converted value on success. It does not send anything if a valid number can't be parsed.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Receives a string packet and sends an empty packet.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/string-to-empty

out_ports.description: Sends an empty packet when any string is received.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to int.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/string-to-int

out_ports.description: Sends the interger-converted value on success. It does not send anything if a valid number can't be parsed.
out_ports.name: OUT

out_ports.description: Sends a blob packet with the contents of the string received in the port IN.

types.description: Receives a timestamp packet and converts it to a string one.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the timestamp to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/timestamp-to-string

members.description: Format string to be used in the conversion. The syntax is the same as strftime().
members.name: format

out_ports.description: Packet with formatted date and time.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Receives a string packet and converts it to a timestamp one.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: converter/string-to-timestamp

members.description: Format string to be used in the conversion. The syntax is the same as strftime().
members.name: format

out_ports.description: Packet with timestamp converted from string received on port IN using format set on options.
out_ports.name: OUT
